title: NOAA-DOE Precipitation Processes and Predictability workshop report released
content:
Thunderstorms dropped 4-9 inches of rain across a large swath of Tennessee in late March 2021, causing widespread flash flooding. Credit: NOAA Climate.gov
How can we improve our ability to predict precipitation variability and extremes? To answer this question, CPOâ€™s Earth System Science and Modeling (ESSM) Division and the DOE Earth and Environmental Systems Sciences Division (EESSD), in partnership with USGCRP and the U.S. Climate Variability and Predictability Program (US CLIVAR), jointly organized a community workshop in late 2020 focused on advancing understanding of precipitation predictability and exploring ways to reduce precipitation biases. The NOAA-DOE Precipitation Processes and Predictability workshop report is now available.
